intro: Moraea nana, commonly known as the dwarf moraea, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant produces delicate, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, often with a contrasting central stripe. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its compact size and attractive blooms, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
